questions: What does the term ‘Drainage’ mean?
answers: The term ‘drainage’ describes the river system of an area.

questions: What is a ‘drainage basin’?
answers: The area drained by a single river system is called a drainage basin.

questions: Which part of the land is called ‘water divide’?
answers: Any elevated area, such as a mountain or an upland separates two drainage basins. Such an upland is known as a ‘water divide’.

questions: Into which two major groups are Indian rivers divided?
answers: The Indian rivers are divided into two major groups (i) The Himalayan Rivers (ii) The Peninsular Rivers

questions: Which rivers are called perennial?
answers: Perennial rivers are the ones which have water throughout the year. These rivers receive water from rain as well as from melted snow from the lofty mountains.

questions: Which river has the largest basin in India?
answers: River Ganga

questions: Why are Peninsular rivers called seasonal?
answers: A large number of peninsular rivers are seasonal as their flow is dependent on rainfall and even the large rivers have reduced flow of water in the dry season.

questions: Name the rivers which originate in Central Highlands & flow towards the west.
answers: Rivers Narmada and Tapi.

questions: What is a river system?
answers: A river along with its tributaries may be called a river system.

questions: From where does river Indus originate?
answers: River Indus originates in Tibet, near Lake Mansarowar.

questions: Which are the main tributaries of river Indus?
answers: The Satluj, the Beas, the Ravi, the Chenab and the Jhelum are the main tributaries of river Indus.

questions: Name the main tributaries of the river Ganga.
answers: The Yamuna, the Ghaghara, the Gandak and the Kosi are the main tributaries of river Ganga.

questions: How is Sunderban Delta named?
answers: The Sunderban delta has derived its name from Sundari trees which grow well in marshland.

questions: By what name is Brahmaputra known in Tibet and Bangladesh?
answers: In Tibet it is known as Tsang-Po and in Bangladesh it is called Jamuna.

questions: Why does river Brahmaputra carry less water in Tibet?
answers: In Tibet, the river carries a smaller volume of water & less silt as it is a cold and a dry area.

questions: Name the major Peninsular rivers.
answers: The Mahanadi, the Godavari, the Krishna and the Kaveri.

questions: Which two peninsular rivers form estuaries?
answers: Narmada and Tapi.

questions: Which are the main west flowing rivers of Western Ghats?
answers: Sabarmati, Mahi, Bharatpuja and Periyar.

questions: Which river is the largest Peninsular river?
answers: The Godavari, its length is about 1500 km.

questions: Which river is called ‘Dakshin Ganga’?
answers: Godavari is called ‘Dakshin Ganga’ because of its length and the area it covers.

questions: What is ‘Shivasamudram’?
answers: The river Kaveri makes the second biggest waterfall in India.

questions: Name some of the freshwater lakes of India.
answers: The Wular lake, The Dal lake, Bhimtal, Nainital, Loktak and Barapani.
